translation.en: More of that in a moment, but here's Jill with something else.
translation.ko: 그 얘긴 잠시 후에 하죠 질이 나와 있어요

translation.en: Struggling away, hello.
[Jill Dando] Television in some way had always fascinated me from the year dot.
translation.ko: 어떤 면에서 텔레비전은 처음부터 늘 저를 매료시켰어요

translation.en: I was about eight years old and I'd have my four library tickets
and go to the library and get books about television.
translation.ko: 도서관에 가면 텔레비전에 관한 책을 빌렸죠

translation.en: [female reporter] Good morning.
You're watching the BBC's Breakfast News at 6:30.
It took me I suppose, um, until I was about 25 to get inside.
[woman 1] Jill Dando.
[man 1] Jill was the most famous TV presenter on British television.
translation.ko: 질은 영국 텔레비전에서 가장 유명한 TV 진행자였어요

translation.en: [woman 2] The golden girl of British television,
murdered on her doorstep in broad daylight.
translation.ko: 대낮에 자기 집 문 앞에서 살해된 거예요 "암살 '처형'"

translation.en: That just does not happen.
[woman 3] I think anyone who has got a little bit of fame
knows that there are two sides to it.
You get a lot of unwanted attention.
Strange people. Obsessive.
You kind of look over your shoulder a bit.
People all over are joining again
to solve some of Britain's most difficult and serious crimes.
translation.ko: 심각한 범죄를 해결하려고 사람들이 다시 모였습니다

translation.en: [woman 2] Crimewatch had a fantastic reputation
for putting information out there
and getting people to ring in with critical pieces of evidence.
If you harbor any suspicions, do call. So many clues and so much anguish.
translation.ko: 의혹이 있다면 전화 주세요 단서도 많고 너무나 비통합니다

translation.en: Do you ever get worried about the things you see on Crimewatch?
Oh. Yes, you do. But the crimes that we show are so rare.
It's not something that you walk into the street
and think, "The same thing's going to happen to me."
[woman 3] There was reason to be scared.
[man 2] It takes a certain sort of person,
a brutal sadistic psychopath, to shoot a gun into a head.
This was one of the largest murder investigations
translation.ko: 이는 런던 경찰국이 당면했던 살인 사건 조사 중에

translation.en: the Metropolitan Police ever had to face.
[man 1] It's been 22 years and it's unsolved.
Whoever did it is still out there.
One of Britain's most popular television presenters has been murdered
translation.ko: 영국에서 가장 인기 있는 텔레비전 진행자가 살해됐습니다

translation.en: in what could be a professional hit.
The tributes here on the flowers echo the overriding reaction of shock…
translation.ko: 이 근조 화환들은 엄청난 충격을 반영하는 듯…

translation.en: [man 1] Even the Queen has been moved to comment, saying she is shocked…
[man 2] Police say there are many possible motives for the murder.
[man 3] …responsible for solving so many crimes may have created enemies in the process.
translation.ko: 수많은 범죄를 해결하는 과정에서 적이 생겼을지도 모릅니다

translation.en: [woman 1] The Crimewatch presenter may have been assassinated in retaliation
for the NATO bombing of the Belgrade.
[man 4] Detectives confirm that Jill Dando
translation.ko: 수사관들에 따르면 질 댄도는 스토커가 미행했다고

translation.en: had claimed of being followed by a stalker.
translation.ko: 수사관들에 따르면 질 댄도는 스토커가 미행했다고 주장했고…

translation.en: [woman 2] A man who has gone on trial in London
translation.ko: 유명 인사와 총기에 집착해 온 한 남성이

translation.en: had an obsession with celebrities and was fascinated with firearms.
translation.ko: 유명 인사와 총기에 집착해 온 한 남성이 런던에서 재판받았습니다

translation.en: [man 5] Detectives say they're not ruling out any line of inquiry.
translation.ko: 수사관들은 어떤 수사도 배제하지 않고 있습니다

translation.en: Some believe the killer may have got away with murder.
[man] Ambulance service, hello?
[woman] Hello, ambulance? I'm walking along Gowan Avenue.
It looks like, um, there's somebody collapsed.
And, confidentially, it looks like it's Jill Dando.
And she's collapsed on her doorstep. There's a lot of blood.
translation.ko: 자기 집 문 앞에 쓰러져 있고 피가 흥건해요

translation.en: [man] Can you approach and check that she's breathing?
-[woman] Doesn't look like she is. -[man] Right.
translation.ko: - 숨을 안 쉬는 것 같아요 - 그렇군요

translation.en: [woman] Blood's coming from her nose, her arms are blue.
[man] I need to find out if she needs… if she's breathing.
Is the lady's chest going up and down?
[woman] Oh, my God. No. I don't think she's alive.
translation.ko: 맙소사, 아뇨 살아있는 것 같지 않아요

translation.en: -[man] Okay. -I'm sorry.
[man] Don't worry. I'll get help for you.
[woman] Please.
[man] I was on call for the central London murder group.
We had been busy, we were under-resourced.
And I was told by my detective sergeant
that there had been a stabbing down in Fulham.
translation.ko: "해미시 캠벨 상급 수사관" 풀럼에서 누가 칼에 찔렸다는 거예요

translation.en: Fulham was a well-to-do, wealthy area.
So it was unusual for that reason.
Very unusual.
I was driving down there
and I got a phone call from my chief superintendent.
And he said to me, "That case, that's going to be Jill Dando."
In most homicide cases,
the detectives would not have known their victim at all,
translation.ko: 수사관이 피해자를 아는 경우가 전혀 없는데

translation.en: but in this case, almost everybody knew of Jill Dando.
translation.ko: 질 댄도를 모르는 사람은 거의 없었죠

translation.en: There was an ambulance coming up the Fulham Road as we were going down,
and I realized that was her being taken away from the scene.
translation.ko: 현장에서 질을 싣고 가는 차라는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [woman] It was a lovely spring day…
and I was reading the bulletins, the news summaries.
The next scheduled bulletin is at 2:40.
I had put on a rather nice blue suit.
Well, one actually that came from the designers
translation.ko: 질과 자주 가던 "제니 본드 BBC 아나운서"

translation.en: that Jill and I used to go to together.
And everything was fine in the newsroom, which is a buzzy, noisy, vibrant place.
translation.ko: 보도국은 평소와 다름없이 시끄럽고 활기차 있었어요

translation.en: [man] …page 45. Tell me what promos you're running?
And then the news came in that a woman had been killed.
translation.ko: 그때 한 여자가 살해됐다는 뉴스가 들어왔는데

translation.en: And these rumors started going around the newsroom that it was Jill.
translation.ko: 피해자가 질이란 소문이 보도국에 돌기 시작했죠

translation.en: And it went terribly quiet.
[Hamish Campbell] When I arrived, I was briefed by the uniformed officers.
And they told me that no one had seen what had actually happened to Jill.
translation.ko: 질한테 일어난 일을 직접 본 사람은 없지만

translation.en: But they had already identified two witnesses
who had seen a man leaving the scene.
And they described this white man, dark hair, thick-set,
wearing a coat, a dark coat, wasn't masked, wasn't wearing gloves.
translation.ko: 어두운색 코트를 입었고 마스크나 장갑은 안 꼈댔어요

translation.en: So the real focus right there was how the person
who had been seen running away was to be caught.
Uniformed officers were told to spread out and search the area.
translation.ko: 제복 경찰들이 흩어져 그 일대를 수색했어요

translation.en: We were waiting for information from the hospital
because there was no confirmation that Jill had died.
translation.ko: 질의 생사가 확인 안 된 상태였거든요

translation.en: That changed very quickly when I stood on the pavement
translation.ko: 그 상황은 순식간에 바뀌었죠 인도에 서서

translation.en: and just looked from the gate,
up to the front door of Jill's house.
And I could see the bullet and casing on the doorstep.
translation.ko: 총알과 탄피가 문 앞에 떨어져 있었습니다

translation.en: Jill Dando had been shot in the head.
It was immediately sort of unfathomable.
The concept of any woman being shot in the head in London,
yet alone a celebrity, was rare in the extreme.
translation.ko: 머리에 총을 맞는 건 극히 드물거든요

translation.en: The media are already up at the top cordon.
I knew then that the media interest was going to be extraordinary.
translation.ko: 언론의 관심이 엄청날 거란 걸 그때 알았습니다

translation.en: [male doctor] Jill Dando arrived here by ambulance at 12:30 p.m.
translation.ko: 질 댄도를 태운 구급차는 12시 30분에 이곳에 도착했습니다

translation.en: Despite all efforts by ambulance paramedics and hospital medical staff,
she was certified dead at 1:03 p.m.
The newsroom was cold with… with shock.
Real shock.
We're people who are used to reporting
on all sorts of deaths, disasters, wars.
But to have one of your own…
[laughing] I'm sorry. It's just I was…
[Jennie] One of your very, very own,
killed in that manner on her own doorstep was just too awful to believe.
translation.ko: 자기 집 문 앞에서 살해당하다니 너무 끔찍해 믿을 수가 없었어요

translation.en: And I… I had to read it.
[man] Jill was 37.
[Jennie] I remember a boss saying to me, "Are you going to be okay doing this?"
translation.ko: 방송국 윗분이 와서 읽을 수 있겠냐고 묻길래

translation.en: And I said, yeah, I'll be okay.
[man] Jill was 37.
Pete, I'm telling you she was 37.
All right.
[man] I told her, she was 37.
She was exactly two years younger than me. She was 37.
What shall I say?
[man] I'm telling you, she was definitely 37. Definitely.
Here we go.
Within the past few minutes, police have confirmed
that the BBC television presenter Jill Dando has been stabbed to death
translation.ko: BBC 방송 진행자 질 댄도가 웨스트런던 자택 밖에서

translation.en: outside her west London home.
She died in the ambulance on her way to hospital.
There are no more details at the moment.
The next scheduled bulletin is at 2:40.
I was working in the, uh, Bristol office
of the Bristol Evening Post.
And our newsroom had a bank of TV screens.
translation.ko: 보도국에 TV 스크린이 쭉 늘어서 있었어요

translation.en: Our BBC colleague Jill Dando has died
after being attacked outside her London home.
translation.ko: 런던 자택 밖에서 공격을 받아 사망했습니다

translation.en: [Nigel] Reports were coming out that she had died.
I clicked into sort of automatic mode.
I thought I need to protect my dad from this.
I rushed down to Weston-super-Mare.
He was obviously devastated.
I was wondering how we were going to cope with all this.
About half an hour after I had got down to Weston,
the TV reporter from BBC Points West knocked on the door. I knew him.
translation.ko: 'BBC 포인츠 웨스트' TV 리포터인 제 지인이 찾아왔어요

translation.en: And I sort of slipped back into journalistic mode.
I gave him an interview.
[man] When did you last see her? Was it…
I saw her on, um… Easter Sunday.
It would've been about two, three weeks ago.
Yeah, she was on good form. Um, looking forward to her wedding.
It was a sense of emptiness and a sense of despair.
And I had to explain to my dad what had happened,
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있었고 어떤 일이 생길지

translation.en: what was going to happen.
That we were kind of going to be in the eye of a storm.
translation.ko: 우리가 폭풍의 눈 속으로 들어갈 거란 것을요

translation.en: [male reporter] The police search is well underway now, Alan.
There are a minimum of 30 detectives.
You can see behind me the operation in front of Jill's home.
translation.ko: 질의 집 앞에서 수사 중인 게 제 뒤로 보이실 거예요

translation.en: [Hamish] All the resources came.
The ballistics experts, the blood experts, the scene photographers.
translation.ko: 탄도학 전문가 혈액학 전문가, 현장 사진사

translation.en: The scene itself had been heavily contaminated.
Because there had been attempts to resuscitate.
But everything was picked up, relevant or not, scrapings, gravel.
translation.ko: 그래도 관련 여부를 떠나 모두 수거했어요, 부스러기, 자갈

translation.en: Fingerprint marks from the gate.
Fibers.
We had a bullet and a cartridge casing on the doorstep.
translation.ko: 문 앞에 총알과 탄피가 떨어져 있었어요

translation.en: The ballistics expert told me it was a single shot
translation.ko: 탄도학 전문가 말이 왼쪽 머리에 대고

translation.en: to the left side of her head.
Some thought like a professional execution.
And that bullet and casing on the doorstep were from a 9mm caliber weapon.
translation.ko: 문 앞에 있던 총알과 탄피로 볼 때 총은 9mm 구경이었어요

translation.en: The search teams arrived.
The whole of Gowan Avenue was searched.
Bins, gardens, flowerbeds, shrubs.
Looking to see if the gun had been discarded or anything had been discarded.
translation.ko: 총이든 뭐든 버려진 게 없는지 확인했죠

translation.en: We identified some of the key witnesses.
The postman, a sort of Mediterranean-looking man,
just after ten o'clock on the opposite side of the road to Jill's house,
translation.ko: 10시가 조금 지나 질의 집 방향 맞은편에서

translation.en: and a witness claimed he saw a man running across the road
translation.ko: 한 남자가 길을 가로질러 달려가는 걸 봤다더군요

translation.en: and he stopped at the bus stop.
And he was sweating.
There was a traffic warden,
and she was about to give a ticket to the driver of a blue Range Rover,
translation.ko: 파란 레인지로버 운전자에게 위반 딱지를 떼려고

translation.en: and as she was starting to write the ticket out,
he brushed her off and he drove away.
So, I didn't know at the time
whether there was one person involved or two or three.
Everybody in that street on that day had to be eliminated out
translation.ko: 그날 그 거리에 있던 사람 중 최대한 많은 사람을

translation.en: as much as possible.
The next day's newspapers were absolutely rammed with stories about the murder.
translation.ko: 다음 날 각종 신문에 살해 기사가 실렸어요 "제프 에드워즈 '더 미러' 범죄 특파원 역임" "'더 선' 암살"

translation.en: It was the only story in town.
translation.ko: "세상을 떠난 만인의 연인" 다들 그 얘기만 했죠

translation.en: On a sad morning, we'll be talking about poor Jill Dando.
translation.ko: 슬픈 아침입니다 질 댄도 얘길 곧 하겠지만…

translation.en: The shocking loss of one of Britain's best-known personalities
translation.ko: 영국 최고 유명 인사의 죽음에 많은 이가 애도를 표했습니다

translation.en: drew many tributes.
In London, police are investigating a murder
translation.ko: 텔레비전 시청자들에게 충격을 준 살인 사건을

translation.en: that has shocked the television-viewing public.
[reporter 1] Jill Dando was, in the opinion of many in Britain,
second only to Princess Diana
in terms of public affection.
Jill Dando was someone who was known to, virtually, everybody in this country.
translation.ko: 사실상 이 나라에 질 댄도를 모르는 사람은 없었죠

translation.en: [reporter 2] Even the Queen has been moved to comment, saying she is shocked and saddened.
[woman] Following the death of Princess Diana,
I would say that Jill Dando's murder
was the biggest story that we will ever report on.
translation.ko: "제인 무어 기자 겸 방송인" 크게 보도한 기사는 없을 거예요

translation.en: Female journalists of my generation were shaken by it
because we saw ourselves in Jill.
Jill had been a journalist. She loved the press.
She was good to us, she respected us, she knew we were doing a job
translation.ko: 우리한테 잘했고, 우릴 존중했고 우리가 프로란 걸 알았어요

translation.en: and we wanted as much as the police
to find out who did it because she was one of us.
translation.ko: 범인을 밝혀내고 싶었습니다 질은 우리 중 하나였으니까요

translation.en: I was the crime correspondent at the Daily Mirror.
translation.ko: "'더 데일리 미러' 본사 런던 카나리워프" 전 그때 '데일리 미러' 범죄 특파원이었어요

translation.en: I can remember discussing it with… with my news editor.
And him saying to me, "So, what do you think about this?"
He said, it must be something with Crimewatch.
Well, not necessarily, hold your horses.
One of the pieces of information coming in from one of our reporters on the ground
translation.ko: 현장에 나가 있던 기자가 소식을 전해 왔는데

translation.en: was that they'd found a neighbor to Jill's house in Gowan Avenue
translation.ko: 질의 집이 있는 가윈가에서 비명을 들은

translation.en: who'd heard a scream.
-[reporter] Did you hear a man's voice? -No man's voice at all.
translation.ko: 남자 목소리는 못 들었나요? 그런 건 못 들었어요

translation.en: -Did you hear a shot or did you-- -There was no shots.
From what I'd say was a shot, I didn't think there was a shot, no.
[reporter] From your assessment, what did you hear?
I did hear… a scream.
I had a private conversation
with one of the members of the murder squad.
He said we cannot find any witnesses, any neighbors,
translation.ko: 사건 발생 당시 현장 주변에서 총성을 들은

translation.en: anybody who was in the area at the time who actually heard a gunshot.
translation.ko: 목격자나 동네 주민은 찾지 못했다고 하더군요

translation.en: We don't have the gun. We don't have anybody who saw the gun.
translation.ko: 총도, 총을 본 사람도 찾지 못했고요

translation.en: But this weapon could have had a silencer on it.
Unlike in the movies,
a silencer on a gun is a very rare piece of equipment in real life.
translation.ko: 현실에서 소음기를 쓰는 건 극히 드물죠

translation.en: So, automatically, that suggestion steered us in the direction
that maybe this was a professional job.
Somebody asked the question, is this an assassination?
Is this an execution?
Like a political murder or an organized crime murder?
So all the theories about, you know, the who, the what, the why,
were starting to stack up.
[male reporter] Jill Dando was left dying on the doorstep of her home.
translation.ko: 질 댄도가 자택 앞에서 살해된 건

translation.en: Revenge, perhaps, for her role as a crime reporter who helps jail top criminals.
translation.ko: 흉악범 체포에 일조한 데 대한 복수였을지도 모릅니다

translation.en: Everyone had a view on how Jill Dando was murdered and who was responsible.
translation.ko: 질의 살해 경위와 범인에 관해 다들 나름의 의견이 있었죠

translation.en: Back to the office, I held a meeting with the team.
I said, there's a danger of us being swept up with the media hype.
translation.ko: 우리가 언론의 과대 선전에 휩쓸릴 위험이 있다고 했어요

translation.en: And reminded them that, with any murder investigation,
translation.ko: 어떤 살인 사건에서도 사건 해결을 위한 핵심 요소는

translation.en: the victim was a key element to try to solve the case.
So we needed to look at Jill's life.
Who is Jill
and who were the persons closest to her and nearer to her?
translation.ko: 가장 가까운 사람은 누구였고 주변에 누가 있었나?

translation.en: I don't, I'm afraid.
I'm one of these people who what you see is what you get.
I don't think I've got any skeletons in the cupboard.
translation.ko: 제 찬장에 해골 같은 건 없어요

translation.en: [Nigel] I was nine years old when Jill was born in 1961.
Quite often on a Sunday as a family,
we'd go down for a picnic on the beach.
Do you remember those sand-blown lettuce sandwiches?
They were part of the staple diet
of summers growing up in Weston-super-Mare.
There wasn't much money around.
We didn't have exotic holidays like that.
I wonder whether she actually had a passport
before she was offered the job as, uh, presenting the Holiday program.
It was almost preordained that she was going to become a journalist.
translation.ko: 질이 기자가 되리라는 건 거의 정해져 있었죠

translation.en: Well, she was interested in words and, um, she was more outgoing than I was.
I'd whisper in her ear occasionally saying, "Why are you still in Weston?"
translation.ko: 가끔 걔 귀에 속삭이곤 했어요 '왜 아직 웨스턴에 있어?'

translation.en: "Why don't you look for jobs around the place?"
Thirty years ago, a computer capable of similar calculations
translation.ko: 30년 전만 해도 비슷한 계산이 가능한 컴퓨터는

translation.en: wouldn't have fitted into a building this size.
It would have been full of…
[Nigel] She got a job as a journalist on BBC Spotlight, based in Plymouth.
translation.ko: 플리머스에 본사를 둔 'BBC 스포트라이트' 기자로 있다가

translation.en: And then became a presenter.
They do mention the ethics committee refusing this idea.
translation.ko: 그들은 윤리위원회가 이 생각을 거부한다고 해요

translation.en: They've said no more sisters are going to be donors.
translation.ko: 수녀들이 더는 기증하지 않을 거라고 했죠

translation.en: [Nigel] She was so polished and so professional.
…Fisherman depend is in deep financial trouble.
[Nigel] But at the same time retaining a natural warmth about her.
Sort of a twinkle in her eye.
Her performances on Spotlight
caught the attention of the producers at BBC Breakfast.
[man] …television made, is going up the line to Breakfast Time.
[Nigel] The world by then was her oyster.
-I must just-- -How many times have I done this now?
translation.ko: - 아무래도… - 내가 몇 번이나 이러고 있죠?

translation.en: Thank you very much. Oh, God. [laughs]
-We wish you well, my darling. -Thank you.
You better say goodnight for the last time.
Good night from here and good morning from London on Monday.
translation.ko: 여기선 작별이지만 월요일 런던에서 뵐 거예요

translation.en: [producer] Page 45. Now, would you tell me what promos you're running?
Give me that. Just hold on a second.
No, Bob, I've got to know now.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 밥, 지금 알아야 해

translation.en: Run the first one. I'll confirm in a couple of seconds.
translation.ko: 처음 걸로 해 조금 있다 확인해 줄게

translation.en: I'm Bob Wheaton.
At that time, I was, uh, running the six o'clock news.
translation.ko: "밥 휘턴 질의 옛 연인, BBC 편집자 역임" 당시에 저는 6시 뉴스를 맡고 있었어요

translation.en: I can remember.
There I was sitting at the desk.
I'm ready to get the six o'clock news of the day prepared.
And there on, um, BBC Breakfast Time…
-Dementia has found more evidence… -…was Jill.
…possible link with aluminum levels…
[Bob] Hadn't seen her before.
[Jill] The study, published in…
She had a good face for television.
While Frank Bruno's been preparing for his fight…
[Bob] Her voice, beautiful, a classless English voice.
…tussling with a television crew in Canada.
She was a total natural.
Winds of up to 100 miles an hour…
[Bob] She shone and I knew she was gonna go places.
translation.ko: 빛나고 있었어요 크게 성공하리란 걸 알았죠

translation.en: But I think how you look does matter.
And she'd arrived from provinces looking like a regional girl.
I'd looked at her and said to her, "You need to sort the way your hair is,
translation.ko: 질을 보곤 말했습니다 '머리 좀 어떻게 해 봐'

translation.en: you need to wear the right clothes." She'd put on a lot of weight.
translation.ko: '옷도 제대로 챙겨 입고' 체중이 많이 나갔죠

translation.en: And, you know, she was advised that she needed to look right.
At the time she had curly, permed hair.
Um, brown.
translation.ko: "마틴 맥시 질의 친구 겸 미용사" 갈색이었고요

translation.en: And she wanted a different look.
I think I suggested that we cut this short and, uh, see where we go with it.
translation.ko: 일단 짧게 자른 다음 어떻게 할지 보자고 했어요

translation.en: And she said, "I'm going to be on television. Should I ask my producer?"
And I went, "No, probably not a good idea."
The government's £3.25 billion package to keep down the poll tax
translation.ko: "인두세" 인두세를 줄이기 위한 정부의 32억 5천만 파운드 정책이

translation.en: has been welcomed by Conservative backbenchers.
[Martyn] It became quite a signature look.
And in many ways I think people saw Jill as a TV Diana.
translation.ko: 질은 여러 면에서 TV 속 다이애나처럼 보였을 겁니다

translation.en: At that time, Diana would come down
translation.ko: 당시 다이애나가 가끔 우리 숍에 와서

translation.en: and we would probably do the occasional blow-dry.
[male interviewer] Who had the haircut first?
Jill.
[Bob] Her hair was right. She had lost a lot of weight.
Her diction was perfect. She had a charm about the way she presented the news.
translation.ko: 발음도 흠잡을 데 없었죠 뉴스 전달 방식도 매력적이었고요

translation.en: Well, a fine weekend in prospects.
And people regarded her as a girl next door
who was giving them, uh, the authority of BBC News and it was a good package.
I suppose in celebrating the success, we got closer.
translation.ko: 성공을 축하하면서 우리 둘은 더 가까워졌고

translation.en: And, uh, eventually we became involved.
[Jennie] Jill got involved with Bob very early on,
so that was always quite-- I don't want to say this on camera.
translation.ko: 그래서 항상 꽤… 카메라에 할 말은 아니네요

translation.en: It was a difficult situation. She was… She was with the boss.
I think the top will probably be South Africa again.
translation.ko: 남아공 소식이 또 톱뉴스가 될 것 같아

translation.en: Today, or rather today…
[Jon] I always thought it was a very strange relationship
translation.ko: 늘 둘의 관계가 너무 이상하다고 생각했어요

translation.en: because she was so freewheeling…
And he was quite a control freak, but in a very quiet way.
translation.ko: 밥은 통제광이었는데 그걸 아주 조용히 했죠 "존 로즈먼 질의 에이전트"

translation.en: There was no bad word said, it was like I, you know…
translation.ko: "존 로즈먼 질의 에이전트" 나쁜 말도 쓰지 않고, 그러니까…

translation.en: "Shh. Let me explain. This is what it is." It was that kind of relationship.
…section which has got library film and graphics and so on.
translation.ko: 그 섹션에 도서관 필름과 그래픽 같은 걸 넣어

translation.en: Jill was at the top of her game.
translation.ko: 질은 선두에 있었어요 "아나스타샤 베이커 친구 겸 동료"

translation.en: She'd choose what she wanted to do.
translation.ko: "아나스타샤 베이커 친구 겸 동료" 뭐든 선택할 수 있었죠

translation.en: I was brought in as a young journalist, I think I was about 23.
translation.ko: 제가 젊은 기자로 입사한 게 23살 때였을 거예요

translation.en: I really looked up to Jill.
Um, she was absolutely where I wanted to end up.
The headlines this morning…
[Anastasia] But it was really hard.
It was difficult not to feel a bit of an imposter.
translation.ko: 자신이 사기꾼이란 생각이 안 들 수가 없거든요

translation.en: [Jill] Could we have? I wouldn't mind some scripts.
[Anastasia] Sitting next to these alpha males, sometimes she was made to feel inferior.
translation.ko: 강한 남성 옆에 있으면 때론 열등감이 들게 마련이니까요

translation.en: So often when he's talking to ladies who say
it's harder for us in broadcasting.
And I keep thinking, absolute nonsense, I mean, you know,
translation.ko: 전 그게 말도 안 된다고 생각해요

translation.en: if you're a good-looking woman, then it is not difficult.
-It, well… -It is easier.
No. I think people expect more of women, that's the trouble, you know…
translation.ko: 사람들이 여자들한테 더 많은 걸 기대한다는 게 문제예요

translation.en: As Jill's, uh, career is advancing,
one of the problems that she had,
all the women had, was that it was a very male-dominated company.
translation.ko: 모든 여성이 겪었겠지만 방송국이 남성 위주였다는 겁니다

translation.en: To be absolutely honest, it was quite misogynistic.
All sorts of men will be regarded as controlling
because men are especially… Tough editors are tough sometimes.
translation.ko: 남자들은… 특히 터프한 편집자는 엄할 때가 있거든요

translation.en: But controlling in a way which is detrimental to the relationship
or to the person, not at all.
The reality is, most people are killed by someone they know.
The people in her inner circle were Alan Farthing, her fiancé.
translation.ko: 질의 측근에 남자는 셋이었죠 약혼자인 앨런 파딩

translation.en: Her previous partner for, who had been her partner for some years, seven years.
Mr. Wheaton.
And her business agent, Mr. Roseman.
They had to be seen and interviewed and eliminated primarily by alibi.
If you could show you were somewhere else on the 26th of April, in that time frame,
translation.ko: 4월 26일 그 시간에 다른 곳에 있었다는 걸 증명하면

translation.en: you can't be the murderer.
But it doesn't necessarily remove yourself from somehow arranging for her murder,
if that was the situation.
First of all I wanted to ask how you're coping at the moment.
I think I'm coping in the same way as
anybody else would cope under the circumstances.
I'm devastated.
Everybody around me is devastated.
[Alan] I cannot understand why they would want to kill -somebody as gentle… -This was my mother's…
translation.ko: 왜 죽였는지 이해가 안 돼요 그렇게 다정하고

translation.en: …kind, well-meaning and
as perfect a person as Jill.
[Nigel] I'll always remember it.
We were in the back of a limousine following Jill's coffin.
translation.ko: 리무진 뒷좌석에 앉아 질의 관을 따라가는데

translation.en: There were just thousands of people who'd come out.
Weston just stopped.
I didn't know her personally, but I thought I'd like to be here.
translation.ko: 개인적인 친분은 없지만 여기 오고 싶었어요

translation.en: [woman] Diana was our rose, but Jill was our sunflower.
I can't say any more.
[male reporter] A hundred or so people were invited to the church.
Many of her friends worked with her at the BBC.
translation.ko: 친구 중 대다수가 BBC에서 함께 일한 동료입니다

translation.en: The coffin arrived at the church at three o'clock.
It was accompanied by her brother, Nigel.
Her father, Jack.
And, of course, by the man she would have married this September,
her fiancé, Alan Farthing.
[Martyn] When Jill met Alan, it was quite a life-changing moment for her.
translation.ko: 앨런을 만남으로써 질의 인생은 완전히 바뀌었죠

translation.en: A moment that she'd thought about and had dreams of for quite a while.
She'd announced her engagement.
translation.ko: "질 댄도 아름다운 약혼 사진 공개" 약혼을 발표했었죠

translation.en: She should have been in a church getting married, you know,
and here she was in a church being buried.
[priest] Life was entering a new, exciting, fulfilling age.
translation.ko: 새롭고, 신나고, 보람 있는 삶으로 접어들고 있었습니다

translation.en: Until that fateful moment,
Jill, the beautiful girl next door,
translation.ko: 전국의 모든 가족과 "명복을 빕니다 웨스턴의 다이애나"

translation.en: known to every family in the country, was shot dead.
translation.ko: 만인의 연인이었던 질은 총에 맞아 사망했죠

translation.en: And then everyone was asking the question, "Why?"
[Hamish] Some of my key thinking about it was,
if someone deliberately set out to kill her,
why would they choose to kill her? What was to be gained from that?
What benefit would anybody accrue from killing Jill Dando?
translation.ko: '질을 죽여서 누가 어떤 이득을 본 걸까?'

translation.en: And then Alan Farthing mentioned that a large sum of money,
translation.ko: 그때 앨런 파딩이 질이 3만, 3만 5천 파운드가 넘는

translation.en: was given by Jill to Mr. Wheaton.
So, that had to be investigated as to why that sum of money had been given over.
translation.ko: "계좌 이체 - 35,000.00" 왜 그 돈을 준 건지 조사해야 했습니다

translation.en: [Bob] After the funeral, the police came to see me.
And one of the policemen goes, "Well, we've had this report
that you owed her quite a lot of money,
um, and you still owed it to her when she died."
translation.ko: 질의 사망 당시 갚지 않은 상태였다며

translation.en: "Uh, would you like to explain that?"
I said, "Yeah. Yeah. I'm quite happy to do that."
And you sort of feel, gosh, you know, the light is on me here.
They wanted to know about how we met,
um, how long we'd been together, uh, how did we break up.
And yes, she had contributed towards me buying my house by the river.
translation.ko: 강변에 있는 집을 살 때 질이 돈을 보탰어요

translation.en: I said, I had a mortgage, um, but there was a small shortfall.
I could've had a bigger mortgage, but she wanted to share
because we were then sharing the house together.
translation.ko: 질이 도운 건 함께 살았기 때문이에요

translation.en: And by the way, I do not need that much money that badly.
translation.ko: 그 돈도 꼭 필요했던 건 아닙니다

translation.en: I can show you the evidence of why, and I took him to my computer,
went into my bank account and showed him, um, that I had quite a lot of money.
translation.ko: 제 계좌에 꽤 많은 돈이 있었거든요

translation.en: She was generous to everybody, including me.
We loved each other.
I wouldn't have ever thought of doing something like that.
To have lost somebody with whom, uh, I had spent valuable, interesting,
translation.ko: 소중하고, 흥미롭고, 중요하고 즐거웠던 세월을 함께 보낸

translation.en: important and enjoyable years was a massive blow.
[Hamish] Well, the things that are innocuous can appear suspicious.
translation.ko: 악의 없는 것들이 의심스러워 보일 수도 있어요

translation.en: I think it was just a gift from Jill to Mr. Wheaton.
translation.ko: 그 돈은 질이 휘턴에게 준 선물이었을 거예요

translation.en: You know, you talk about things in detail
but when following death, things can emerge,
but they're almost tittle-tattle, gossip, salacious or otherwise.
But it doesn't move you into the realm of responsibility for killing someone.
translation.ko: 그런 건 범인을 잡는 데 도움이 안 되죠

translation.en: We concluded that he was…
he had nothing to do with the murder at all.
And we needed to sift out all that noise
and try to really focus on basic principles
translation.ko: 점점 더 엉뚱한 길로 가기 전에

translation.en: before getting carried away further and further down different avenues.
Jill didn't live at 29 Gowan Avenue.
She lived with her fiancé, further out in West London.
We knew she visited Gowan Avenue rarely and stayed overnight even more rarely.
translation.ko: 가윈가엔 자주 안 갔고 밤에 거기서 묵는 건 더 드물었죠

translation.en: So to know that Jill would turn up at 29 Gowan Avenue
on Monday morning by 11:30,
translation.ko: 질이 나타날 걸 알았다면 "질의 마지막 행적"

translation.en: you would have to have been following her.
[detective inspector] I was the deputy on the inquiry.
It was a painstaking process.
Two officers going through
the many hundreds of hours of CCTV.
translation.ko: "이언 호록스 경위" 수백 시간 분량의 CCTV를 확인해야 했거든요

translation.en: There were thousands of people to eliminate from the inquiry.
translation.ko: 수사를 통해 배제한 사람이 수천 명에 달했죠

translation.en: Nothing would be discounted until each had been evaluated
to a degree by one of the team.
There was over 190 CCTV and cameras in the surrounding streets.
translation.ko: 주변 거리에 190대가 넘는 CCTV와 카메라가 있었어요

translation.en: Four hundred and thirty hours of viewing time.
And from that we established Jill's movements on the 26th of April.
Started from Alan Farthing's home.
She stopped at a petrol station.
Filled the car with petrol.
And then she left the petrol station and she went into Hammersmith town center.
translation.ko: 그러곤 주유소에서 나와 해머스미스 타운 센터로 갑니다

translation.en: Went to at least two shops, maybe three, to buy some fax paper or copying paper.
translation.ko: 두세 군데 상점에 들러 팩스 내지 복사 용지를 사요

translation.en: She returned to her car.
Then she left Hammersmith and travelled south down to Fulham Road.
translation.ko: 해머스미스를 떠나 풀럼가를 향해 남쪽으로 가죠

translation.en: Then she got down to near Gowan Avenue,
parked right outside her house.
And then she walked up the gateway.
And killed at the doorstep.
[Ian] It was simply a matter of just plodding through everything.
And we can categorically say, 100%, that she wasn't followed.
translation.ko: 그래서 질이 미행당하지 않았다고 100% 단언할 수 있습니다

translation.en: So, how did the killer know
that she was going to be at Gowan Avenue that morning?
And then the thinking
is that Jill told somebody where she was.
So we did look at the phone calls to her on that day.
translation.ko: 그래서 그날 질의 통화 기록을 확인했습니다

translation.en: Who knew she was going to be where she was?
translation.ko: 질이 그곳에 간다는 걸 누가 알고 있었을까요?

translation.en: There was one person alone.
Mr. Roseman.
Jon Roseman was Jill's very colorful agent.
translation.ko: 질의 에이전트였던 존 로즈먼은 꽤 흥미로운 사람이죠

translation.en: Um, I had lots of dealings with Jon over the years.
translation.ko: 저 역시 오랫동안 존을 수없이 상대했는데

translation.en: He was very, uh, shall I say, robust to deal with.
translation.ko: 뭐랄까, 절대로 상대하기 쉬운 사람은 아녜요

translation.en: He was very straight-talking. Uh, you knew when you'd upset him.
There's a very famous story about him
going around somewhere with a baseball bat to, uh… to show his feelings.
translation.ko: 자기감정을 표현하려고 야구 방망이를 들고 다녔대요

translation.en: [Jon] The police, they came to visit me on a Saturday morning.
And they asked me about this timeline.
Because the only reason she went there that day was to pick up some faxes
translation.ko: 질이 그날 그곳에 간 건 일과 관련해

translation.en: that had been sent to her from my office about some work.
translation.ko: 제 사무실에서 보낸 팩스를 받기 위해서였거든요

translation.en: She was on her way to a lunch, I think it was.
translation.ko: 아마 점심 먹으러 가는 길이었을 거예요

translation.en: And so she just, like, literally stopped off
back to her house to pick up faxes.
One of the things that they were interested in was my book.
I had always wanted to be a writer.
And so I had written a book.
translation.ko: 그래서 책을 하나 썼어요 "초고 V 15 존 로즈먼 씀"

translation.en: They always say, write about what you know,
translation.ko: 자신이 잘 아는 걸 쓰라고 하잖아요

translation.en: so I wrote about an agent.
An agent whose clients were murdered under mysterious circumstances.
A client who'd been shot.
[Hamish] Mr. Roseman had written a book
which involved the death of a presenter or personality.
translation.ko: 진행자 내지 어떤 인물의 죽음에 관한 것이었죠

translation.en: So that seemed ironic that he's writing a novel
which actually then occurred in real life.
[Jon] The police, there were two of them, sitting in my office,
and we talked it through
and they asked me if I had a manuscript of the book, which I did.
translation.ko: 책의 원고가 있냐고 하길래 그렇다고 했죠

translation.en: And they also said, "What was the time difference
translation.ko: 그러곤 또 묻기를 소설에서 첫 번째 살인과

translation.en: between the first murder in the book and the second murder in the book?"
translation.ko: 두 번째 살인 사이의 시차가 얼마냐는 거예요

translation.en: And I'm thinking, like I was in the Twilight Zone.
I thought, he's not taking this seriously,
like somebody's had my manuscript and is following the plan of the book?
translation.ko: '그대로 따라 한 거라고 생각하는 건 아니겠지?'

translation.en: [male interviewer] Did you think whether others might be suspecting you?
Well, I'd have to have paid someone to do it, that's for sure.
But I had this reputation,
and yes, I was really tough, but it was just an act.
And anybody who suspected that I would cut off
translation.ko: 질 댄도 같은 수입원을 제 손으로 제거하다니

translation.en: a financial revenue like Jill Dando's would have to be insane.
translation.ko: 미치지 않고서야 어떻게 그런 의심을 하죠?

translation.en: [director] Action.
Well, that's all for this--
Hang on, I can't see the lens.
[man] When you turn, bring your body around. Oh, okay, right. I'm going…
translation.ko: - 몸 전체를 같이 돌려요 - 알겠어요, 제가…

translation.en: [Jon] I mean, it sounds terrible, but had we not sent her any faxes…
translation.ko: 끔찍하게 들리겠지만 우리가 팩스를 안 보냈다면…

translation.en: That's all from Mauritius.
Next week I'll be on the Greek island of Skiathos.
I'm not going to say--
Had she not gone back to the house that day, it wouldn't have happened.
translation.ko: 그런 일은 없었을 거라는 말을 하려는 게 아닙니다

translation.en: Who knows how, where else it would have happened,
translation.ko: 어디서 어떤 일이 있었을지 누가 알겠어요?

translation.en: but that was the reason she went back to the house.
translation.ko: 다만, 그날 집에 간 게 그것 때문이라는 거죠

translation.en: I do find this kind of stuff really difficult to talk about.
Oh! It's just so glamorous. It's wonderful. Let me at it.
Everything was going so well for her.
I came here unescorted, but I'm told that a prince is waiting in the wings.
translation.ko: 파트너 없이 왔는데 왕자님이 절 기다리고 있대요

translation.en: [Jon] I mean, nobody has a life like that, right?
We would love to have a life like that, right?
But Jill had a life like that.
It's not! It's not. It's not.
Listen, I'm… Jill, I'm so sorry about this.
I… I find her death still difficult to come to terms with.
translation.ko: 질의 죽음이 아직도 이해가 안 돼요

translation.en: -Do you mind if I whirl her away? -Oh, you may whirl. I can't believe it.
translation.ko: 질과 춤춰도 되겠죠? 물론이죠, 꿈만 같네요

translation.en: There you go.
None of that inner group of people was responsible for Jill Dando's murder.
translation.ko: 질의 측근 중에는 그녀를 살해한 사람이 없었어요

translation.en: And we still didn't have an understanding of the reason why Jill had been killed.
translation.ko: 우린 질이 살해된 이유도 여전히 알아내지 못했죠 "주요 수사대"

translation.en: We had to properly focus down.
Who was the man who had been seen running away?
Who was driving the blue Range Rover?
And who was the sweating man?
[Jeff] I knew by then from talking to my contacts,
that the murder of Jill Dando caused, you know, huge consternation
translation.ko: 질 댄도의 죽음에 런던 경찰국 고위층도

translation.en: within the hierarchy at Scotland Yard as well
because Jill Dando was perceived as part of the policing family.
translation.ko: 질도 경찰 가족의 일원으로 인식되고 있었으니까요

translation.en: But they were bedeviled by the fact that they didn't have a suspect.
They didn't have a murder weapon.
[Hamish] Morning.
Are you any closer to knowing either a suspect or a motive for this killing?
translation.ko: 용의자나 살해 동기에 관해 좀 더 알아낸 게 있습니까?

translation.en: We don't know the person who killed Jill Dando at this time
and we're trying to establish a motive as to why she was killed.
And our main inquiry focuses on determining the motive.
translation.ko: 동기를 밝히는 데 초점을 맞추고 있습니다

translation.en: Once we establish the motive, we will be able to move forward more rapidly
as to who the suspect or suspects are.
The red-top news business won't tolerate a vacuum, right?
translation.ko: 타블로이드 신문은 진공 상태를 견디지 못하죠

translation.en: They want information. They've got pages to fill.
I could see the clouds gathering on the horizon
and I knew, unless they solved this crime really quickly,
it was only a short matter of time
before we started to become deluged with all sorts of theories.
[reporter] In the absence of any obvious motive for the attack,
translation.ko: 공격에 대한 뚜렷한 동기가 없을 땐

translation.en: speculation, and it is only that, focuses on a possible stalker.
Jill Dando had had problems with obsessive fans in the past,
translation.ko: 친했던 동료에 따르면 질 댄도는 집착하는 팬들 때문에

translation.en: as one close colleague recalls.
I don't think she was in any sense, in fear of, certainly not in mortal fear
translation.ko: 그냥 짜증 나는 정도였지 "닉 로스 '크라임워치' 진행자"

translation.en: of anything happening to her. She was irritated from time to time.
translation.ko: 질이 극도의 공포를 느꼈다고는 생각지 않아요

translation.en: Uh, there had been somebody stalking her.
translation.ko: 질이 극도의 공포를 느꼈다고는 생각지 않아요 스토커가 있긴 했지만

translation.en: Um, I mean, to be honest, that's really, it goes with the turf.
translation.ko: 솔직히 공인인 이상 어쩔 수 없잖아요

translation.en: Anyone who is in the public eye, and Jill was in the public eye
more than almost anybody, um, does have certain threats.
translation.ko: 그런 사람은 위협을 느낄 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: We used to get all the mail coming to our office.
translation.ko: 예전엔 우편물이 모두 우리 사무실로 왔어요

translation.en: Some mail might be a little bit eh-eh,
so you had to be careful and just take some of these letters away.
But they weren't threatening, they were just, well, you know.
There's a lot of perverts out there.
But then we received a letter from somebody claiming to be a Serb.
translation.ko: 그러다가 자칭 세르비아인이 보낸 편지를 받았는데

translation.en: It was in relation to the appeal
that Jill had given earlier that month for Kosovo.
This weekend we've all become aware
of the humanitarian crisis facing the Balkans,
translation.ko: "질 댄도" 발칸반도가 직면한 위기를 알게 됐습니다

translation.en: as thousands of people from Kosovo…
[Jon] The letter seemed to be somewhat threatening.
Whatever you can afford can make a big difference to these people's lives
translation.ko: 여러분의 관심은 이들의 삶과 생존 가능성을

translation.en: and their chances of survival.
[Jeff] The Balkan War had been going on in the former Yugoslavia,
translation.ko: 발칸 전쟁은 옛 유고슬라비아에서 벌어진 것으로

translation.en: you know, which had split into various states,
you know, Serbia and Kosovo and so forth.
It was a very horrible war.
So, when it started to emerge that her agent had a threatening letter…
translation.ko: 질의 에이전트가 협박 편지를 받은 게 알려지며

translation.en: Then the BBC started to get threats by telephone.
The hair on the back of my neck stood up.
[male reporter 1] The murder of one of the country's best-known TV personalities
translation.ko: 영국에서 가장 유명한 방송인 살인 사건이

translation.en: has taken a frightening turn.
[male reporter 2] The TV center where Jill Dando worked received a phone call.
translation.ko: 질 댄도가 근무했던 TV 센터에 전화가 걸려왔습니다

translation.en: It was from a man claiming to be Serbian,
saying he was behind the star's death.
translation.ko: 스타의 죽음의 배후에 자신이 있다고 주장했습니다
